reviewText: I consider myself at an intermediate level of fitness.I have other workouts by this instructor.  Generally, I like her but find her weight workouts much better than her cardio workouts.  This is my first step workout.  I did not try the tutorial first and jumped right in.Pros:  This is a great mix of weights and cardio.Lots of tricep work which may be a con for others but a pro for me.I was able to follow along the first time round without major frustration.  I was behind enough that first try that I did not really get a good cardio workout.  By the second attempt, I had remembered enough to feel that I had a good workout.The moves are repeated enough and simple enough that I felt it was good for a beginner to pick up.  That said, I always feel this instructor's cardio moves and transitions are always slightly on the awkward side --- since there is a tutorial I won't count this as a con but I feel other instructors are able to do a better job of slowly adding onto the routine, building up the complexity of the moves, and keeping the flow from being awkward.  Probably the best method I have seen is slowly adding on segments and repeating everything from the top to reinforce what you learned with instructor demonstrating new segments while you hold a jog or other simple move to keep up your heart rate as you watch the next move being demonstrated.Camera work is good --- no bad focus, shaking, or unnecessary zooms.At a minimum, I want music with a strong beat that instructor follows and I can follow.  That said, I have to put the music in the pro segment even though I have to say it was rather on the awful side.I always prefer a music only option on workouts to cut out the chatter but, in this case, there is no unnecessary chit chat and music is not great so is ok as is."Backup dancers" were non-annoying which, again, is pretty much all I can ask.  One is a modifier for lower impact/intensity for those who need it.Cons:Cuing was not great.  Sometimes there, sometimes not.  Also, most annoyingly, "singles" and "doubles" are used interchangably to cue you as to number of arms to work and timing to the beat.  Very confusing.  Repeating the workout should eventually compensate for cuing problems.Backdrop is somehow rather eighties living room uninspiring or something but a lesser consideration than other aspects.Overall, I enjoyed this workout for the good mix of weights and cardio, simpler/repeated moves that I do not have to strain my brain over, and ability to do in a cramped area without major modification.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Really liked this girl.  Not overboard like others I have tried and she was fun and informative.  She has another that I'm thinking of trying because she is good however for now I use this a few times a week and I'm happy with it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This entire workout is over one full hour which is great because you only need to do this once to have your daily benefit requirement of exercise.  Kelly is a very good instructor who is motivating and not at all annoying.  She has geared this workout for an advanced exerciser for sure.  It's quite tough and challenging and I love a good challenge.There are five circuits and they all start with a fair bit of step and then moves onto targeted body sculpting.  Then when you think you're over that, it continues with a 60 second cardio burst and yet another set of the same muscle toning.  You get tired easily but it's worth doing it to see if you can get to the other side.Believe me, this is tough but so worth trying.  Despite the 'torture', I love pushing myself and I love the feeling when you're done.  It feels good and even the next day when you're sore, you know you've done something great for yourself.  Give this a go if you are anywhere from intermediate to advanced.  This isn't for beginners, but for them, it's something to aim for.  I highly recommend this workout.

reviewText: I utilized this dvd once, don't get me wrong, I LOVE Kelly, just not this dvd! I'm not a fan of using a stepper, I find it "boring"!But I own a few other of her dvds, which I like just fine! She will work OUT, like Jillian and Debbie! I gave it to my daughter,she likes it a lot!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really enjoy this workout! I love that it works every muscle in your body. I love using weights with cardio. A+ overall rating. Now that I have said that I will warn you. If you enjoy a bubbly, motivating, "you can soooo do this" instructor... this workout is NOT for you. Kelly is straight forward, dry and all about the workout, I don't mind this. What's important to me is that I sweat and get rid of calories and fat and with this dvd I DO! I will admit this is my first and only dvd with Kelly so I'm not sure if she is always this way but it will not stop me from getting a second. If you take nothing else from this review know that with this workout you are gonna "feel the burn" :-)
Title: N/A
